page.title: 06HOME LIFE - Lydham/More
page.content: The woman's part in the home has been greatly changed by{labour saving {devices}such as washing machines, food mixers, vacuum cleaners, deep freezers and central heating (though most homes still have at least one open fire). As some wives also go out to work, house- hold chores and child care are often shared with husbands, enabling both to enjoy social pursuits. Television, videos, computers, telephones and radios play a large part in home life of all ages. There is{no shop}in the area so people travel 2 miles to Bishop's Castle or 4 miles to a large supermarket at Churchstoke. Bottled milk is delivered to all households 3 times a week and costs 24p per pint. Bread, meat, local evening and National Sunday newspapers are deliv- ered. Coal and mobile library call, and refuse is colllected, fortnightly.
